channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bangladesh Protests Inequality of Opportunity
item.description: Demonstrations set off by the reinstatement of a quota system for government jobs revealed broader resentment about the uneven distribution of wealth and opportunity.

item.title: Monday Briefing
item.description: Here’s what you need to know.

item.title: Tourism has hijacked Santorini’s wine production as agricultural land becomes exorbitant while visitor numbers continue to climb
item.description: The island is expecting 3.4 million tourists this summer, despite local authorities asking for limits since 2012.

item.title: Parts of Oregon, Washington and Idaho Under Extreme Heat Warning
item.description: After a blistering weekend, particularly in inland areas farther from the coast, cooler temperatures are expected beginning early this week.

item.title: World Leaders React to Biden Campaign Decision
item.description: Foreign leaders did not wade into the turmoil of U.S. politics. Many opted instead for statements of empathy that lauded the president’s record.

item.title: World leaders praise Biden’s record after he quits presidential race
item.description: "Ukraine is grateful to President Biden for his unwavering support for Ukraine’s fight for freedom, which, along with strong bipartisan support in the United States, has been and continues to be critical."

item.title: Cheng Pei Pei, Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon Actor, Dies
item.description: She starred in kung fu movies from the modern origins of the form in midcentury Hong Kong to the worldwide breakout “Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon.”

item.title: Bangladesh Protests Inequality of Opportunity
item.description: Demonstrations set off by the reinstatement of a quota system for government jobs revealed broader resentment about the uneven distribution of wealth and opportunity.

item.title: Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer won’t challenge Kamala Harris for presidential nomination
item.description: California’s Democratic governor Gavin Newsom is also reportedly preparing to stand down.

item.title: Kamala Harris Rapidly Picks Up Democratic Support as 2024 Race Is Reborn
item.description: Endorsements cascaded in as the vice president took swift control of the Biden campaign in a transformed contest, though Democrats including Barack Obama did not immediately back her.

item.title: Canadian Politicians Are in No Hurry to Fight Foreign Interference in Elections
item.description: China and India have been accused of exploiting the opaque nomination contests of Canadian political parties to meddle in elections.

item.title: Here’s how Wall Street and business leaders are reacting to Biden’s exit from the presidential race; ‘Father time is undefeated’
item.description: "Biden stepping down is a whole new level of political uncertainty. This may be the catalyst for market volatility that is overdue."

item.title: Campus Protests Led to More Than 3,100 Arrests, but Many Charges Have Been Dropped
item.description: The spate of pro-Palestinian protests and encampments engulfed academic institutions of all sizes in nearly every part of the country.

item.title: The Billionaire Criminal Who Secretly Profited Off Jack Ma’s Deals
item.description: Confidential documents show that Xiao Jianhua, a corrupt investor tied to China’s political elite, backed the country’s most successful and revered entrepreneur.

item.title: Now that Joe Biden has dropped out of the race, what happens to his campaign money?
item.description: "A major party’s presumptive nominee stepping down months before Election Day is not an ordinary event, but it is also not a crisis."
